data.title: Finally found the best burger in Southwest Broward
data.text: Webby's Grub & Pub is an out of the way great local place behind a Publix store on Broward Blvd east of University DR. It's been there a long time. We ate in the Pub section but there is also a separate section for their restaurant. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner. I ordered a burger and for once it was a real handmade burger not a frozen machine made patty. It was cooked perfect and served just the way I wanted it. My son ordered a steak and cheese and it was also excellent. His side was Tater Tots I had fries and a large pickle spear. Perfect with a cold draft beer!

data.title: THE Neighborhood Watering Hole You've Been Looking For!
data.text: Looking for a game on TV, ice cold beer and friendly people?  Swing on over to Webby's Pub & Grub and 9 out of 10 times you'll find the owner  "Webb" behind the bar serving drinks.  He also does double duty cooking in the kitchen and whips up some pretty good "home style" dishes.  Prefer a burger or grilled cheese - it's on the menu. With a family dining room off to the side, I've never been for breakfast but people I know says its great!  This is your local, local, local, local bar if you like beer and they do have wine, but not a large selection.  No hard liquor is served.

data.title: Good breakfast/lunch place in Plantation
data.text: This restaurant has been a neighborhood fixture for many years, and is right outside my door, practically.  Quiet, small, good breakfast (until 11:00) or lunch (until about 3 pm).  Only the bar side is open for dinner.

data.title: Amazing local breakfast place
data.text: It's like our very own Cheers, where everyone knows you're name and you're always glad you came! Delicious food! Excellent prices! Sure to run into someone you know! Lots of friendly faces!

data.title: Yum!
data.text: Recently, my husband & I were taken here by a friend for breakfast & are so glad we discovered this little gem.  Now, whenever we are in the area we make a point of stopping in. They have the most wonderful breakfasts with ample portions. My over-easy eggs were prepared perfectly, the sausage & bacon were delectable & the creamy grits were the best!  The atmosphere is so friendly & the personal service is excellent. What more could you ask?

data.title: Great burgers!
data.text: I went to Webby's for the first time today and it won't be my last. It's an unassuming place in a little strip mall. I hadn't even got inside before I was greeted by a couple of customers. They were friendly. Once inside I made my way to the restaurant half of the bar and grill. Webby, the owner, came to my table and sat down and chatted with me for a bit. We had a nice conversation. I ordered sweet tea, a Webby burger and onion rings. He brought my tea right out. I asked for my burger to be cooked medium and it was perfect. He makes the patties out to order, they are not frozen. After he brought my order out we chatted some more between him tending bar and other duties. I heard the breakfast there is good too so I plan to try it soon. If you are looking for good food and/or a cold beer along with a friendly atmosphere I highly recommend Webby's.

data.title: Where everyone knows your name
data.text: A hidden gem, my go to restaurant for breakfast and lunch.  Small menu with daily blackboard specials, everything is homemade and Rosie the weekday cook is also every one's friend and grandma. Bob the owner is always there to meet and greet and cook  on the weekends, he is also the friendliest bartender since Cheers.

data.title: BREAKFAST AT WEBBY'S
data.text: It's not Tiffany's but it is small, friendly and serves excellent breakfasts often cooked by Webby himself. It is somewhat out of the way but, as always with good restaurants, a steady stream of regulars proves that those in the know have found it OK.

data.title: Cindy
data.text: Great neighborhood bar..really good food..great service. .friendly patrons and cold beer.  Wish I lived closer.

data.title: Great local Pub
data.text: Great neighborhood pub. Just beer and wine. There are two sides to the restaurant, and I would recommend sitting on the bar side so you can sit and chat with the locals and the owner Bob. Always great lunch specials going on. Lots of TV's to watch sports and such. Really a great local Plantation Bar.

data.title: great breafast, kunch and dinner
data.text: great food prepared as you like and priced right, try their Friday night prime rib. Great Breakfast and lunch too...

data.title: Worse than bad
data.text: Friends told me about this place so I thought I would try it. Bad decision. We arrived at 9:15 and our ordervwas taken at 9:40 - way after others who were seated after us. I wanted to leave at that point but my daughter wanted to wait it out. When we finally ordered our food was served long after those that had ordered after us. I could have overlooked it if the food had been good. My sausage was cold inside and the eggs that should have been over easy were over medium. My daughters gravy on her biscuits was cold and the biscuits were dry and tasteless. In all we were there one hour and forty five minutes - I have a lot better things to do on a Sunday morning than be treated like this and served badly prepared food. I will say the prices were reasonable had the food been good.

data.title: Great local pub
data.text: Webby's is a local joint for great food and company.  A "home away from home" type of place.  The owner is always there and great to talk to and share recipes.  Casual and comfortable, with a pool table and other games.  I can never resist their wings.

data.title: Webby's pub and grub
data.text: Good place for breakfast and lunch. Bob Webster, the owner is almost always there and knows his regulars like the back of his hand. Omelets are always excellent, and he has a wide variety of salads and sandwiches for lunch. The pub is on one side and the diner is on the other. Food, drinks, and company are great.
